intro: Grevillea patentiloba subsp. patentiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grevillea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and vibrant red or orange flowers that appear in clusters. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and efficient water use. It belongs to the Proteaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar adaptations. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits in native gardens.
